Please note that the first day of school for the 2020 / 2021 school year will be Thursday August 13th 2020. The last day will be May 28th 2021.

h3.a: Wheels on the electric bus go round and round

div.div: Green Acres Elementary third-graders check out Live Oak School District’s new electric school bus.

Our mission is to empower, inspire and ensure equitable opportunities for every student to thrive. We teach and nurture the whole child in an academically rigorous, collaborative and innovative environment.

The Live Oak School District was established in 1872 and currently serves approximately 1,900 students in three elementary schools, one middle school, one K-8 independent charter school, and one alternative school. The student population is 50% Hispanic, 31% White, 19% Other, 30% English learner, and 60% Socioeconomically disadvantaged.

We are very proud of our schools, teachers, students, and community and are especially excited by developments in recent years to further support our students' experiences. In 2016, Live Oak renewed a parcel tax to support school libraries, art, music, science, and physical activities; this fund will provide approx. $500,000 to schools for these purposes every year. Also in 2016, a new Boys and Girls club opened at Shoreline Middle School that is a result of a partnership between the Live Oak School District, Boys and Girls Club, and the County of Santa Cruz. In 2013, Live Oak was designated a "Playful City USA" community by KaBOOM! for its commitment to childhood play; and in 2013, Live Oak Elementary School won an Imagination Playground through a KaBOOM! grant/Facebook vote. These activities demonstrate the investment and excitement about living and learning in Live Oak that we hope will continue.

h2.a: Live Oak School District - Look at Us!!

Location: Bring mom flowers

Our mission is to empower, inspire and ensure equitable opportunities for every student to thrive. We teach and nurture the whole child in an academically rigorous, collaborative and innovative learning environment.
Dear Live Oak District Families,

I understand that this continues to be a challenging time for all of our families as we deal with the changing conditions in response to COVID-19. I know that the challenges vary with each family. Balancing the hurdle of sheltering in place, with children learning at home, as well as struggling to meet basic family needs is extremely difficult.

We want to support our students, families and staff during this time and ensure that their health and safety come first in all our school decisions and planning. Today, the superintendents across Santa Cruz County have made the decision to extend the school closure through the end of the school year in June. Please see the attached letter from all district superintendents for more details. Though we expected this was likely to occur, it is sad for all of us to know that students will not be back in their physical classrooms this school year. We miss them and we miss you!

Now, more than ever, our Distance Learning Program is critical to your child’s academic growth and success. All 4th-8th grade students now have Chromebooks. Parents were given information on how to apply for free online access if needed. Students should be logging on to Google Chrome for assignments every school day and attending Zoom meetings as scheduled by their teacher(s). Many teachers in the primary grade levels have also started communicating online with students and families and are providing distance learning instruction. We need everyone’s help to make this a reality for ALL our students.

This week 3rd grade students, and TK-3rd students receiving Special Education services, can check- out a Chromebook at designated dates and times if they need one. We have ordered Chromebooks which should arrive soon after Spring Break for 2nd grade students who need devices. With the help of the Live Oak Education Foundation, we are raising funds to purchase additional Chromebooks to check-out to TK-1st grade students who may also need them. The Live Oak Education Foundation will match all donations up to $5000. Please see my attached letter for more information and a link to donate. Also, please share it with your own family and friends to help support our youngest learners!

TK-5th Packet Pick-Up This Week! In order to get our distance learning packets out to you sooner (to be used after Spring Break), the elementary schools have scheduled new dates for packet pick-up THIS WEEK: Green Acres: Thursday, April 2nd- 7:30 a.m.-1:00 p.m. Del Mar : Thursday, April 2nd- 12:00 p.m.-3:00 p.m. Live Oak: Thursday, April 2nd- 9 a.m.-1 p.m. & Friday, April 3rd- 9a.m.-12 p.m.

Grab and Go Meals During Spring Break, April 6-10 To help support our families during Spring Break, the Boys and Girls Club, next door to Shoreline School, will provide grab and go meals to all children ages 1-18 from 8:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m. during Spring Break. Children do not need to be present to receive grab and go meals.

We are disappointed that with the extended school closure, we will all miss many of the events that help to make our students’ time in school memorable: events such as 5th grade Outdoor Science School, special field trips, and those important transitions such as promotion and graduation ceremonies. Though they may not happen as planned, we will seek alternatives, wherever possible, and provide you with more information regarding these in the coming months.
Thank you for working together to support your child’s well-being and academic progress.
Sincerely,
Dr. Lorie Chamberland
Superintendent
